about:
Nottingham Trent University (NTU) is a forward-thinking institution known for its emphasis on practical learning and strong links with industry. Established in 1992, NTU has quickly gained a reputation for its excellent teaching quality, student satisfaction, and focus on employability. The university’s modern, city-center campus in Nottingham provides students with access to world-class facilities and a vibrant social scene. NTU is known for its innovative programs in business, law, art, and design, as well as its commitment to sustainability and social responsibility.

NTU places a strong emphasis on work placements, internships, and real-world learning, ensuring that students gain the skills and experience needed to excel in their chosen careers. The university’s close partnerships with industry and its strong graduate employment rate make it one of the leading universities for employability in the UK. With a diverse student body and a welcoming, inclusive environment, Nottingham Trent University offers a dynamic and career-focused education that prepares students for success in a rapidly changing world.

Student Jobs.On-campus Opportunities: Campus jobs include roles as student ambassadors and mentors, with additional opportunities advertised on jobs boards and at career fairs.

Transportation.Parking: Free student parking is available on-campus at Brackenhurst Campus and Mansfield Hub.
Transportation.Airport Access: East Midlands Airport is 15 miles from Nottingham, with dedicated bus services to the city.

Local and Campus Transport.Free Travel: Students in off-campus residences like Maltings and Meridian receive free travel passes.
Local and Campus Transport.Mansfield Hub: 30% bus travel discount is available for students traveling from Nottingham to the Mansfield hub.
Local and Campus Transport.Discounted Travel: Discounts available on bus and tram travel with Nottingham City Transport (NCT) and NET for students.

Students' Union.Sports: NTU is ranked 8th in the British Universities and Colleges Sports (BUCS) championship for 2023, reflecting its strong sports culture.
Students' Union.Overview: Nottingham Trent Students' Union (NTSU) provides access to a variety of societies, sports clubs, communities, and events.
Students' Union.Clubs and Societies: Over 130 societies, communities, and groups for a range of interests, from gaming and knitting to anime and chess.

Living in Nottingham.Overview: NTU has five university sites across Nottingham and surrounding areas, from the vibrant City Campus in the heart of Nottingham to the countryside setting of Brackenhurst.

Nightlife and Culture.Sports: Known as England's official home of sport, Nottingham offers football at Nottingham Forest and Notts County, cricket at Trent Bridge, and activities at the National Ice Centre and National Water Sports Centre.
Nightlife and Culture.Nightlife: Nottingham has held Purple Flag status since 2010 for its diverse, entertaining, and secure nightlife. The music scene includes gigs at Motorpoint Arena, festivals like Splendour, and venues such as Rescue Rooms, Bodega, and Rock City.
Nightlife and Culture.Arts and Literature: Nottingham is a UNESCO City of Literature, with renowned theatres, art galleries, and cinemas.
Nightlife and Culture.Shopping and Dining: A top shopping destination with a variety of high street chains, unique stores, and a diverse food and drink scene.

Facilities.Adaptations: Accommodation guidance is available for disabled students, with adapted rooms upon request.
Facilities.Security and Utilities: All NTU and UPP-managed halls include CCTV, security staff, contents insurance, Wi-Fi, and utility bills.

Room Types.Options: NTU offers a range of accommodation types, including en suite bedrooms with shared kitchens, shared bathrooms, and studio apartments.
Room Types.Special Accommodation: Options are available for postgraduate and mature students (21+), including studios, flats, and shared houses.

Student Accommodation.Accommodation Guarantee: All new full-time undergraduate students are guaranteed accommodation in Nottingham for their first year.

University Highlights.Course Options: NTU offers a diverse range of courses and is known for high-quality teaching and facilities.
University Highlights.Clubs and Societies: A wide range of clubs and societies provides opportunities for skill-building and social engagement.

Opportunities with Degree.Employment: Studies indicate that NTU graduates have a higher average salary than non-graduates.
Opportunities with Degree.Further Education: Undergraduate degrees provide pathways to master's and PhD programs for advanced specialization.

about:
The University of Greenwich, located in the heart of London, is known for its picturesque campuses and commitment to providing high-quality education across a wide range of disciplines. Established in 1890, the university has a rich history and is particularly recognized for its strong programs in business, engineering, architecture, and health sciences. Its main campus in Greenwich is set within a UNESCO World Heritage site, offering students a unique and inspiring backdrop for their studies. Greenwich’s other campuses in Medway and Avery Hill also provide excellent facilities and access to industry.

Greenwich places a strong emphasis on employability, offering students opportunities for work placements, internships, and industry collaborations. The university’s global outlook is reflected in its diverse student population, with students from over 140 countries. With a strong focus on practical skills, research excellence, and global engagement, the University of Greenwich equips its students with the knowledge and experience needed to succeed in their careers, both in the UK and internationally.

Student Jobs.On-campus Opportunities: Students can find part-time roles at university events, support roles within the SU, or through jobs boards and career fairs.

Campus Access.Public Transport: Avery Hill and Greenwich campuses are close to train stations, with journeys to central London taking approximately 25-30 minutes. Medway Campus is connected to Chatham and Rochester via bus services.

University Transport.Shuttle Service: A free shuttle bus operates between Avery Hill and Greenwich campuses, with additional subsidised transport options available.

Student Support.Accessible Accommodation: Rooms adapted for disabled students are available on all campuses. Support services ensure a safe and inclusive environment.

Students' Union.Overview: Greenwich Students’ Union (GSU) represents over 30,000 students, providing support, a wide range of clubs and societies, and an active events calendar.
Students' Union.Support Services: GSU offers an award-winning advice service and supports students through academic and personal challenges, empowering them throughout their university journey.

Facilities.Support Services: All halls offer Wi-Fi, kitchen and dining facilities, and social areas. A shuttle bus connects Avery Hill and Greenwich Campuses, with additional transportation options for Medway students.

Room Types.Options: Accommodation options include shared flats with en suite or shared bathrooms, self-contained studios, and twin rooms. Rooms are available across Avery Hill, Medway, and Greenwich campuses.

Student Accommodation.Accommodation Guarantee: First-year students are guaranteed a place in university halls if they meet specific criteria.

Living in London and Medway.Overview: London is frequently rated as one of the world’s best student cities, with a vibrant cultural and social scene. The Medway Towns in north Kent, approximately 30 miles from central London, offer a rich maritime history, entertainment options, and proximity to London’s many attractions.

Nightlife and Culture.London: London’s nightlife is renowned, with popular spots like Shoreditch and the West End. The city also offers world-class museums and galleries, many of which have free entry for students.
Nightlife and Culture.Medway: Medway towns such as Rochester, Chatham, and Gillingham host a variety of events, festivals, and nightlife options. The Chatham Maritime retail park is nearby with a cinema, bars, restaurants, and outlets. The Deep End on Medway Campus offers live events and social activities.

University Highlights.Course Options: The University of Greenwich offers degrees with placement or sandwich years, and opportunities to study or work abroad.

Opportunities with Degree.Further Study: Graduates have excellent prospects and can pursue further studies such as a master’s degree or PhD.

about:
The University of Exeter is a top-ranking institution, known for its high-quality teaching and research excellence. Founded in 1955, Exeter is a member of the Russell Group, consistently recognized as one of the leading universities in the UK. Its main campuses, located in the scenic Devon countryside, offer a beautiful and inspiring environment for students to live and study. The university is particularly strong in subjects such as business, humanities, science, and social sciences, with a focus on research that addresses global challenges such as climate change and health.

Exeter places a strong emphasis on employability and student satisfaction, with an excellent track record of graduates securing positions in leading industries. The university’s close ties with employers, combined with opportunities for internships, work placements, and international exchanges, ensure that students are well-prepared for the demands of the global job market. With a diverse and welcoming student community, a commitment to sustainability, and a focus on innovation, the University of Exeter offers a transformative academic experience.

Student Jobs.On-campus Opportunities: Opportunities for part-time work include the Student Campus Partnerships (internships) and the Exeter Student Ambassador Scheme.

Transportation.Airports: Exeter Airport is close to the city, and Cornwall Airport Newquay is 45 minutes from Penryn Campus, offering domestic and European flights.

Campus Access.Walking and Biking: Exeter is compact and walkable, with Streatham Campus 15 minutes from the city centre and St Luke's 5 minutes away. Penryn Campus is 15 minutes' walk from Penryn town centre.

Public Transport.Buses and Trains: Buses connect Exeter and Penryn campuses to nearby cities and towns. Exeter has a free minibus service from St David's railway station to its campuses, while Penryn is a short bus or train ride from Falmouth.

Student Support.Support Services: Accessible rooms are available, and the residence wellbeing team provides support to ensure students’ welfare.

Students' Union.Overview: The Students' Guild represents Exeter students, while the Falmouth and Exeter Students' Union represents Cornwall students. The Guild has over 300 societies and the SU in Cornwall offers more than 120.
Students' Union.Facilities and Support: Societies cover a broad range of interests and hobbies, helping students build community and get involved.

Living in Exeter.Overview: The University of Exeter spans four campuses, two in Exeter (Streatham and St Luke's) and two in Cornwall (Truro and Penryn). The beautiful setting in Devon and Cornwall offers students a mix of city life and coastal charm, with easy access to nature.

Nightlife and Culture.Entertainment: Exeter’s nightlife includes alternative venues like Cavern and diverse events due to its student population. Falmouth, with its arts university, offers a unique cultural vibe. Both cities feature a range of food festivals, independent restaurants, and local producers.
Nightlife and Culture.Arts and Sports: Exeter is a UNESCO City of Literature with museums and cinemas, while Falmouth boasts a strong arts culture. The South West is known for its food culture, and Exeter Chiefs Rugby Club adds to the city’s sports scene. Both cities have ample water sports, cycling, and outdoor activity options.

Facilities.Support: Facilities include campus security, residence wellbeing teams, shops, cafes, bars, sports parks, and laundrettes, with a focus on creating a safe and supportive environment.

Room Options.Types: Options include catered and self-catered rooms, en suite, shared bathroom, shared occupancy, and self-contained studios to suit varied budgets and preferences.

Student Accommodation.Accommodation Guarantee: A wide range of students are guaranteed accommodation if they apply by the specified deadlines.

University Highlights.Course Options: Many degrees offer placement years, industrial experience, and study abroad opportunities, enhancing employability skills.

Opportunities with Degree.Further Study: Exeter’s programs prepare students for further study at the master's or PhD level, as well as successful career paths in a variety of fields.

about:
St Mary’s University, Twickenham, established in 1850, is one of the UK’s oldest Catholic universities, offering a nurturing and inclusive environment that values academic excellence alongside personal and spiritual development. Located in a leafy part of southwest London, the university provides students with a peaceful campus setting while being just a short train ride away from the heart of the city. St Mary’s offers a wide range of undergraduate and postgraduate programs, with particular strengths in education, sports science, and the humanities.

With a strong commitment to social justice and community engagement, St Mary’s fosters a supportive atmosphere where students can thrive academically, personally, and professionally. The university is known for its excellent teaching standards and strong student satisfaction. Its close-knit community, emphasis on values-based education, and focus on employability ensure that students graduate with both the skills and the confidence to make a positive impact in their careers and wider society.

The University for the Creative Arts (UCA) London campus is situated in Epsom, Surrey, approximately 20 miles southwest of central London. While UCA primarily offers on-campus housing, students seeking off-campus accommodation have several options in the surrounding areas.

In Epsom, private student accommodations such as Wilberforce Court provide modern living spaces with amenities like communal kitchens and social areas. Additionally, nearby towns like Guildford and Kingston upon Thames offer a variety of private rentals, including shared houses, flats, and studios, catering to different budgets and preferences. These areas are well-connected to Epsom via public transportation, ensuring convenient access to the university.

For those interested in exploring private accommodation options, UCA's Accommodation Services offers guidance and resources to assist in finding suitable housing. They provide information on local rental markets, advice on tenancy agreements, and support throughout the accommodation search process.
about:
The University for the Creative Arts (UCA), with its campuses across London and the Southeast, is a leading institution for creative education, offering specialized programs in fields such as fashion, design, fine arts, film, architecture, and performing arts. With a legacy that dates back over 150 years, UCA has earned an international reputation for its innovative teaching, world-class facilities, and a strong focus on creative practice. The university’s London campus is located in a vibrant creative hub, offering students unparalleled access to the city’s cultural and artistic resources.

UCA is committed to fostering creativity and originality, providing students with the opportunity to work on real-world projects, collaborate with industry professionals, and showcase their work on international platforms. Its graduates are highly sought after in the creative industries, known for their technical skills, creativity, and adaptability. With a diverse and supportive learning environment, UCA nurtures the next generation of creative leaders, offering a transformative education that is both inspiring and practical.

London Business School (LBS) is one of the world’s premier business schools, known for its global impact in business education, leadership development, and cutting-edge research. Founded in 1964 and located in the heart of London, LBS offers a range of world-class programs, including MBA, Executive MBA, and specialized master’s degrees in finance, management, and leadership. Its diverse and international student body, combined with a world-class faculty, makes LBS a hub for business innovation and thought leadership.

LBS has strong ties with global businesses and industries, offering students unique opportunities for networking, internships, and international study experiences. Its emphasis on real-world learning and leadership development ensures that graduates are well-equipped to tackle the complex challenges of the global business environment. With a focus on entrepreneurship, sustainability, and corporate responsibility, LBS fosters a forward-thinking, innovative approach to business education, preparing its students to lead with impact in an ever-evolving world.

about:
Cardiff University, founded in 1883, is one of the leading research-intensive universities in the UK, renowned for its world-class teaching and pioneering research. As a member of the prestigious Russell Group, Cardiff is committed to addressing global challenges through interdisciplinary research and innovation. The university offers a broad range of programs across fields such as medicine, engineering, the humanities, and social sciences, attracting students from all over the world. Its main campus, located in the vibrant capital city of Wales, provides students with a dynamic and culturally rich environment.

Cardiff’s strong focus on employability and career development ensures that its graduates are well-prepared for success in their chosen fields. The university’s strong partnerships with industry, government, and academic institutions provide students with valuable opportunities for internships, work placements, and collaborative research projects. With a welcoming and inclusive community, cutting-edge facilities, and a commitment to sustainability, Cardiff University offers students a transformative educational experience with a global outlook.

Student Jobs.On-campus Opportunities: Students can find part-time roles on campus as student ambassadors, or in cafes, bars, and sports facilities.

Campus Access.Proximity: Cyncoed campus is close to Roath, and Llandaff campus is near the historic village of Llandaff. Both are around 2 miles from Cardiff city centre.
Campus Access.Public Transport: Cardiff Met is well-connected by bus and train. The university offers student bus travel options through Cardiff Bus and Traveline Cymru partnerships.

Regional and International Travel.Airport Access: Cardiff Airport is 30 minutes away by car, with connections to various destinations. Cardiff Met is close to the M4 motorway, providing easy access to major UK cities.

Students' Union.JobShop: The SU JobShop connects students with job opportunities on and off campus.
Students' Union.Overview: Cardiff Met SU supports students in extracurriculars, societies, sports, and personal development, representing the student body’s voice.

Living in Cardiff.Overview: Cardiff is a lively city with a friendly student community, affordable living, green spaces, and a rich culture. Cardiff Met has two campuses: Llandaff and Cyncoed.

Nightlife and Culture.Dining: The city has a mix of popular chains and an award-winning independent food scene with pop-up events and food festivals.
Nightlife and Culture.Sports: Sports enthusiasts can enjoy events at Cardiff City Stadium, Principality Stadium, and local venues for football, rugby, cricket, and ice hockey.
Nightlife and Culture.Entertainment: Cardiff offers a diverse nightlife with traditional pubs, craft beer bars, and nightclubs hosting weekly student events. The music scene is vibrant, with small venues and big concerts at the Principality Stadium.
Nightlife and Culture.Student Areas: Students mainly live in Roath and Cathays, areas full of independent cafes, pubs, and shops within walking distance of the city centre.

Facilities.Residential Life: A Residential Life programme provides free events throughout the year, and quiet and alcohol-free flats are available.
Facilities.Support Services: 24-hour campus security and assistance from the accommodation team, with adapted rooms available for disabled students.

Room Types.Options: The university offers around 1,000 rooms at Cyncoed and Plas Gwyn, with catered, self-catered, and en suite options. Additional en suite rooms are provided through private halls nearby.

Student Accommodation.Accommodation Guarantee: Cardiff Met guarantees accommodation for first-year students meeting the criteria, with options for care leavers available year-round.

University Highlights.Teaching Quality: The university is known for its high-quality teaching and facilities, supporting students to achieve their full potential.
University Highlights.Community and Support: Cardiff Met fosters an inclusive environment and offers diverse clubs, societies, and sports opportunities, known as the Cardiff Met ‘Archers’.

Opportunities with Degree.Career Readiness: Cardiff Met graduates are prepared to enter their chosen fields, with opportunities for placements, internships, and potential pathways to further study.

Queen’s University Belfast, founded in 1845, is a leading UK research university with a distinguished reputation for academic excellence and innovation. As a member of the Russell Group, Queen’s is known for its research output across a broad range of disciplines, including health sciences, engineering, law, and the arts. Located in Northern Ireland’s capital city, Queen’s offers a vibrant campus life in the heart of Belfast, combining academic excellence with a rich cultural and social experience. The university’s beautiful and historic campus provides a unique learning environment, blending tradition with modernity.

Queen’s University places a strong emphasis on employability, offering students excellent opportunities for internships, research collaborations, and professional development. The university has strong connections with industry and government, providing students with real-world experience and career opportunities both locally and internationally. Queen’s diverse student community and global partnerships make it a top choice for students seeking a world-class education in an inclusive and supportive environment.

about:
The University of West London (UWL) is a career-focused institution known for its strong links with industry and its commitment to providing students with the practical skills needed for success in today’s job market. With a heritage dating back to 1860, UWL offers a wide range of programs across fields such as business, healthcare, music, and the creative industries. The university’s campuses in Ealing and Brentford provide a dynamic, urban learning environment, with close proximity to London’s thriving cultural and professional scene.

UWL’s emphasis on employability is reflected in its excellent graduate employment rates, with many programs offering work placements, internships, and industry collaboration opportunities. The university is particularly known for its London College of Music and the Claude Littner Business School, which have produced successful graduates in their respective fields. With a diverse and inclusive student community, UWL provides a supportive and vibrant environment for students looking to combine academic achievement with real-world experience.

Student Jobs.On-campus Opportunities: UWL offers part-time job roles on campus that fit around studies, including student ambassador and SU roles.

Transportation.Campus Shuttle: A free shuttle bus with Wi-Fi runs between the Ealing and Brentford sites every 15 minutes.
Transportation.Travel Discounts: Students can apply for an 18+ Student Oyster photocard for a 30% discount on London travel.

Local and Regional Access.Bike Hire: Several dockless bike-hire schemes operate around the university, with ample bike parking on campus.
Local and Regional Access.Transport Connections: UWL has strong train and road connections across the UK and access to three underground lines, as well as the Elizabeth line, which provides direct trains from Heathrow.

Students' Union.Support: The UWLSU school and course rep scheme ensures students receive support both in and outside the classroom.
Students' Union.Overview: The Students' Union hosts social events throughout the year, providing societies and sports clubs ranging from anime and urban dance to athletics and snow sports.

Living in London.Overview: With excellent transport links, UWL students can experience all London offers while enjoying a welcoming community in one of the city’s greenest and safest areas.

Nightlife and Culture.Partnership: Through a partnership with Premier League team Brentford FC, students can attend matches via ticket draws.
Nightlife and Culture.Local Amenities: The campus is surrounded by diverse restaurants, bars, and shops, and has an SU bar and cafe on campus.
Nightlife and Culture.Sports and Fitness: UWL Sports Centre includes two gyms, fitness studios, and a new sports hub with sports pitches and a multi-use sports centre, thanks to recent investments.
Nightlife and Culture.Students' Union Venue: Freddie's at the Students' Union, named after alumnus Freddie Mercury, offers food, club nights, quizzes, and live bands.

Facilities.Included Costs: Rent includes utility bills, Wi-Fi, 24/7 security, and maintenance support.
Facilities.Additional Amenities: Accommodation sites offer gyms, cinemas, games rooms, study zones, lounges, and regular social events.

Room Types.Options: High-quality and affordable en suite rooms, studios, and 3-bed apartments are available, often at lower rates than direct providers.

Student Accommodation.Accommodation Guarantee: UWL guarantees accommodation for first-year students, with options available throughout the year for care leavers.

University Highlights.Course Options: UWL offers a variety of course combinations with strong teaching quality and support.
University Highlights.Clubs and Societies: A wide range of clubs and societies helps students gain employability and life skills.

Opportunities with Degree.Further Education: Undergraduate degrees provide pathways to master's and PhD programs for deeper specialization.
Opportunities with Degree.Work-based Projects: Many courses include work-based projects, live briefs, or placements to enhance employability.

about:
The University of East Anglia (UEA), located in Norwich, is a leading UK university known for its strengths in research, creativity, and innovation. Established in 1963, UEA has built a reputation for excellence in fields such as environmental sciences, literature, and international development. The university’s beautiful 320-acre campus, with modern architecture and a close-knit community feel, provides students with an inspiring and supportive environment to thrive academically and personally.

UEA is internationally recognized for its research impact, particularly in addressing global challenges like climate change, health, and sustainability. Its interdisciplinary approach to education ensures that students receive a well-rounded learning experience, supported by expert faculty and world-class facilities. UEA’s emphasis on employability, along with its strong industry connections, ensures that graduates are well-prepared for success in a variety of career paths. The university’s vibrant student life, combined with its commitment to research and innovation, makes it a top choice for students from around the world.

Nottingham’s strong focus on employability and global engagement ensures that students graduate with the skills and experiences needed to succeed in a competitive job market. The university has a rich history of international collaboration and offers numerous opportunities for students to participate in exchanges, internships, and research projects. With a vibrant student community, world-class facilities, and a strong focus on research impact, the University of Nottingham offers a transformative academic experience.

Lancaster University, established in 1964, is one of the UK’s top institutions, known for its teaching excellence and strong research output. Regularly ranked among the top 10 universities in the UK, Lancaster offers a broad range of undergraduate and postgraduate programs across fields such as business, engineering, the arts, and social sciences. Its scenic campus is located just outside the historic city of Lancaster, providing students with a friendly and inclusive environment alongside modern facilities.

about:
Founded in 1495, the University of Aberdeen is one of Scotland’s oldest and most prestigious universities, known for its rich heritage and academic excellence. Located in the historic city of Aberdeen, the university offers a stunning campus that blends ancient and modern architecture, providing an inspiring environment for learning and research. Aberdeen is particularly renowned for its strengths in fields such as medicine, energy, and the environment, making it a leader in research and innovation.

As a global university, Aberdeen attracts students from over 130 countries, offering a diverse and inclusive community. The university’s strong focus on employability ensures that graduates are equipped with the skills needed to succeed in today’s job market, with many programs offering internships, work placements, and industry collaboration opportunities. With its strong academic reputation and commitment to addressing global challenges, the University of Aberdeen offers a transformative educational experience.

Student Jobs.On-campus Opportunities: Aberdeen InternPlus offers six-month part-time internships for students, with additional opportunities posted on jobs boards and at career fairs.

Campus Access.Proximity: King's College Campus and Foresterhill Campus are within a 30-minute walk or 20-minute cycle of the city centre.
Campus Access.Shuttle Service: A free shuttle bus connects Hillhead Halls, King's College Campus, Foresterhill Campus, and the city centre.

Local and National Links.Airport: Aberdeen International Airport links to major European hubs and popular tourist destinations.
Local and National Links.Public Transport: Regular train, bus, and ferry services connect Aberdeen with city and rural locations across the UK.

Students' Union.Overview: Aberdeen University Students' Association (AUSA) offers over 180 societies, 55+ sports clubs, and opportunities to participate in representation and campaigns at local and national levels.
Students' Union.Support Services: AUSA Advice provides free, impartial advice covering academics, health and wellbeing, and housing.

Sports.Recreational Facilities: Aberdeen offers over 50 golf courses, five ski centres, and several sports courts and pitches across the city and surrounding areas.

Living in Aberdeen.Overview: Aberdeen is a unique student city with a blend of distinctive architecture, culture, and northern light, close to the sea. The medieval King's College Campus combines old-world architecture with state-of-the-art learning resources.

Nightlife and Culture.Festivals: Annual festivals celebrate music, food, tradition, and art, including the Highland Games and a winter festival of light.
Nightlife and Culture.Dining and Shopping: Aberdeen, birthplace of Brewdog and Mackie's ice cream, has a variety of bars, eateries, well-known restaurants, and independent bistros. The city features five shopping centres and four retail parks.
Nightlife and Culture.Entertainment Venues: From large arenas like P&J Live to intimate spaces, Aberdeen offers live entertainment including comedy, music, and theatre.

Facilities.Support: Dedicated 24/7 support and maintenance teams are available for advice and assistance.
Facilities.Transport: On-site car parking, bicycle storage, and a free shuttle bus service connect the main campus, Foresterhill campus, and Hillhead Village.

Room Types.Options: University-owned accommodation includes rooms within walking distance of the main campus and at Hillhead Student Village, which offers social and study facilities.

Student Accommodation.Accommodation Guarantee: Students are guaranteed a place in university or partner accommodation if they apply by the deadline.

University Highlights.Course Options: The university offers a wide range of degrees, including options for placement or sandwich years, and opportunities to study or work abroad.
University Highlights.Clubs and Societies: Aberdeen provides numerous clubs, societies, and quality teaching and facilities to enhance student experience and skills.

Opportunities with Degree.Employment: Graduates typically enjoy higher average salaries, with career paths that allow them to pursue their passions.
Opportunities with Degree.Further Education: Degrees can lead to master's or PhD programs, enabling students to gain advanced expertise in their fields.

Founded in 1834, Newcastle has a strong academic reputation across disciplines such as medicine, engineering, social sciences, and the arts. The university’s city-center campus in Newcastle upon Tyne provides students with a vibrant and dynamic learning environment, combining academic excellence with a rich student life.

Newcastle is recognized for its strong focus on employability and global engagement, offering students numerous opportunities for work placements, internships, and international study. Its research-driven approach to education ensures that students are at the forefront of innovation and knowledge creation. With a diverse and inclusive student body, a commitment to sustainability, and strong industry links, Newcastle University provides a world-class education that prepares students for success in a globalized world.

Student Jobs.On-campus Opportunities: Students can find paid casual and temporary roles, internships, and ambassador positions through university jobs boards and careers fairs.

Campus Access.Biking: Bike parking is available across campus and within student accommodations.
Campus Access.Public Transport: The Tyne and Wear Metro connects students to the city, coast, suburbs, and airport in under 30 minutes. Newcastle Central Station and Newcastle International Airport provide fast national and international travel.

Transportation.Discounted Travel: Local travel discounts are available, with subsidized options for students under 21.

Student Support.Inclusive Community: The university fosters an inclusive environment, with a multicultural student body and numerous taster sessions to help new students integrate.

Students' Union.Overview: NUSU is one of the UK's largest student unions, offering over 240 societies and clubs that span sports, academics, cultural interests, and more.
Students' Union.Facilities and Support: The SU building includes study spaces, a Support and Advice Hub, a bar, supermarket, music venue, and food outlets.

Living in Newcastle.Overview: Newcastle, a diverse and welcoming city in North East England, is known for its multicultural arts scene, sports, shopping, and vibrant nightlife. It offers students an affordable, friendly environment with easy access to the coast and countryside.

Nightlife and Culture.Entertainment: Major venues like O2 City Hall, NX Newcastle, and the Utilita Arena host music, sports, and comedy events. The Quayside, home to the BALTIC Centre for Contemporary Art and The Glasshouse, is a hub for arts and nightlife. Many galleries and museums in the city offer free entry.
Nightlife and Culture.Arts and Sports: The Ouseburn Valley creative quarter features music venues, art installations, festivals, and artists' studios. Newcastle United FC, based at St James' Park, is at the heart of the city's sporting culture.

Facilities.Amenities: Rooms come with shared or private facilities, communal areas, and laundry rooms. Some include study zones, games areas, and social spaces. Rent includes utilities, Wi-Fi, and personal possessions insurance.

Room Options.Styles: Accommodation ranges from converted Victorian terraces to modern apartments, with self-catered options available for undergraduate and postgraduate students.

Student Accommodation.Support Services: A dedicated ResLife team provides social and life-skills activities and 24/7 security support.
Student Accommodation.Accommodation Guarantee: First-year students are guaranteed a place in university-owned or managed partnership accommodations, given they meet the specified criteria.

University Highlights.Research: As a founding member of the Russell Group, Newcastle University is known for research-led teaching, with degrees shaped by industry links to enhance employability.

Opportunities with Degree.Career Pathways: Students gain valuable skills through placements, study abroad options, and industry partnerships, preparing them for diverse career opportunities.

address: Northampton Square, London EC1V 0HB, UK
onCampusAccommodation:
On-Campus Housing
City University offers several on-campus student residences with convenient access to the main campus and amenities:

Liberty Hall - Located near Angel Station, Liberty Hall offers en-suite rooms with shared kitchen facilities. Prices range around £200 per week.
The Gardens - A quieter residence close to Northampton Square, providing en-suite rooms and a community feel. Rates average about £180-£230 per week depending on room type.
Arbour House - Situated in vibrant Clerkenwell, Arbour House offers en-suite rooms, with weekly prices typically between £250-£300. It includes study spaces and social lounges for residents.
offCampusAccommodation:
On-Campus Housing
City University offers several on-campus student residences with convenient access to the main campus and amenities:

Liberty Hall - Located near Angel Station, Liberty Hall offers en-suite rooms with shared kitchen facilities. Prices range around £200 per week.
The Gardens - A quieter residence close to Northampton Square, providing en-suite rooms and a community feel. Rates average about £180-£230 per week depending on room type.
Arbour House - Situated in vibrant Clerkenwell, Arbour House offers en-suite rooms, with weekly prices typically between £250-£300. It includes study spaces and social lounges for residents.
Off-Campus Housing
For students seeking more flexible or budget-friendly options, various off-campus accommodations are available near the university:

AXO Islington - Located around 20 minutes by bus from the campus, AXO Islington provides a range of room types, including studios and shared apartments, with prices starting at approximately £190 per week.
Don Gratton House - Ideal for students who want more independence, this option is located in East London and offers short-term leases, often suited for exchange students or internships. Pricing starts around £150 per week.
Chapter Islington - A modern residence about a 15-minute bus ride from campus, offering facilities like a gym, study areas, and social spaces, with rates ranging from £240 to £350 weekly.
Pricing and Location Insights
For off-campus housing near City University, average weekly rent varies between £150 and £300 depending on location, amenities, and room type. Proximity to public transport is a major advantage, as most accommodations are near bus stops or Underground stations, facilitating easy commutes to campus and other parts of London​

Choosing Between On and Off-Campus Options
Both on-campus and off-campus accommodations are safe, with amenities like 24/7 security and CCTV. On-campus options offer closer integration with university life, while off-campus housing often provides more flexibility, privacy, and potentially cost-saving options.

Located in the heart of London, City provides students with access to one of the world’s most dynamic cities, offering numerous opportunities for networking, internships, and professional development. City is particularly known for its Cass Business School and its programs in journalism, law, and health sciences.

City’s close ties with industry and its emphasis on real-world learning ensure that students graduate with the practical skills and knowledge needed to excel in their chosen careers. The university’s strong focus on employability, along with its global outlook, makes it a top choice for students looking to build successful careers in a wide range of sectors. With a diverse student body and world-class facilities, City, University of London offers a dynamic and enriching academic experience.

about:
The University of Portsmouth, founded in 1992, is a modern and innovative institution known for its strong focus on employability and practical learning. Located on the south coast of England, Portsmouth offers a wide range of programs in fields such as engineering, business, creative technologies, and health sciences. The university’s campus is integrated into the city, providing students with a vibrant and dynamic environment for both study and social life.

Portsmouth’s emphasis on real-world experience is reflected in its strong industry partnerships, internships, and work placements. The university is committed to providing students with the skills and knowledge needed to succeed in their careers, with a focus on innovation, entrepreneurship, and sustainability. With a diverse student community and a commitment to research that addresses global challenges, the University of Portsmouth offers a forward-thinking and career-focused education.

Student Jobs.On-campus Opportunities: The university and SU employ students in admin, IT, hospitality, marketing, and ambassador roles.

Campus Access.Proximity: Portsmouth's compact campus is integrated into the city centre, with easy access to teaching spaces, halls, shops, and bars.
Campus Access.Local Attractions: The beach, Old Portsmouth, and Gunwharf Quays are all within a 10-minute walk of campus.

Regional and International Travel.Ferry Access: Take a hovercraft to the Isle of Wight or ferries to France, Spain, and the Channel Islands.
Regional and International Travel.Public Transport: Portsmouth is 90 minutes from London by rail, 60 minutes from the New Forest, and offers National Express coach services.

Students' Union.Overview: The Students' Union represents the student voice and enhances university life with over 140 student groups and clubs for networking, socializing, and personal growth.
Students' Union.Events and Community: The SU hosts various social and learning events to help students feel connected to the university community.

Living in Portsmouth.Overview: Portsmouth is a lively, compact city with a rich maritime history, great community spirit, and many entrepreneurial businesses. The beach and Southsea Common are within an easy stroll from campus.

Nightlife and Culture.Recreation: Outdoor activities include kayaking or paddleboarding on the Solent, seafront running, and supporting Portsmouth FC.
Nightlife and Culture.Entertainment: Catch live gigs at the Wedgewood Rooms or dance at Popworld. The city also hosts the Victorious Festival and has comedy, theatre, and dance venues.
Nightlife and Culture.Dining and Shopping: Enjoy local favorites like fish and chips by the sea or unique eateries such as Pie and Vinyl. Portsmouth offers shopping options from designer bargains at Gunwharf Quays to artisans' studios at the Hotwalls.

Facilities.Support: The Residence Life team provides 24/7 welfare support and organizes social events to help new students settle in.
Facilities.Housing Resources: The Student Housing team provides resources and events to help students find properties and housemates.

Room Types.Options: Choices include en suite rooms in flats with kitchen/diners, self-contained studios, and catered or self-catered options. Students can also choose rooms in quiet zones or single-sex areas.

Student Accommodation.Accommodation Guarantee: First-year full-time undergraduates and postgraduates are guaranteed a place in halls if they apply by the deadline.

University Highlights.Course Options: The university has many course combinations, high-quality teaching, and a variety of clubs and societies.
University Highlights.Unique Programs: Portsmouth offers Connected Degrees, allowing students to choose a placement year either after Year 2 or after their final year.

Opportunities with Degree.Further Education: Degrees provide pathways to explore specialized fields or pursue postgraduate study.
Opportunities with Degree.Employability Skills: The university's focus on employable skills and professional experience ensures students graduate career-ready.

Founded in 1796, Strathclyde has a long history of innovation and practical learning, offering students a world-class education that is focused on addressing real-world challenges. The university is renowned for its strong industry links, providing students with numerous opportunities for internships, work placements, and research collaborations.

Strathclyde’s commitment to innovation and entrepreneurship is reflected in its support for start-ups and its focus on sustainability and global impact. The university’s campus, located in the heart of Glasgow, provides a dynamic and culturally rich environment for students to thrive both academically and socially. With a global outlook and a strong emphasis on employability, the University of Strathclyde prepares students for successful careers in a wide range of fields.
